title: Bug 110566: Wrong data set result returned when setting an invalid filter expression row[0]
description: When setting a filter like 'row[0] equals to 0' or just returning a null result set, the data set returns the wrong result. As per the developer, row[0] can only be generated after all the data is fetched and cannot be used as a filter expression.
OB: When attempting to set a filter in the data set with the expression 'row[0] equals to', the first result record is incorrectly returned during preview.
EB: The expected behavior is that row[0] cannot be used as a filter expression.
SR:
To reproduce this issue: 
1. Set a filter in the data set with the expression 'row[0] equals to' 
2. Click on the Preview tab and observe the incorrect result returned.
